contextId.information: It is implied that they should have said what follows. AT: "They should have said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Blood on their clothes was evidence that they had killed people. AT: "The blood of innocent, poor people on your clothes shows that you are guilty of killing them" or  "You are guilty of killing poor and innocent people"(See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The blood that was the life of innocent, poor people has been found on your clothes

contextId.information: The attacking army tries to ensure that their gods will help them during the war by performing ceremonies and making sacrifices. AT: "Prepare for war by purifying yourselves and sacrificing to the gods." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Dedicate yourselves to the gods for the battle

contextId.information: It is implied that, since the temple belongs to Yahweh and represents his presence, he will protect it and the people of Judah will be safe. Possible meanings for why "Temple of Yahweh" is repeated three times are 1) it was repeated for emphasis or 2) it was repeated as part of a temple liturgy. AT: "This is the temple of Yahweh so it is absolutely certain that no one will destroy it and we are safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Temple of Yahweh! Temple of Yahweh! Temple of Yahweh!

contextId.information: This was the name of a false god. AT: "the false god known as 'the queen of the heavens'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
AT: "The people of the land shake with fear" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
This probably refers to people who cut their hair short in order to honor a pagan god. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and all the people who cut the hair on their heads very short

contextId.information: This means that the cities will be surrounded by their enemies who will not allow any one to come in or out of the cities. AT: "The cities in the Negev will be shut up, and no one will be able to go into them or out of them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The cities in the Negev will be shut up, with no one to open them

contextId.information: This can be put into active form. AT: "He will rescue Judah from their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is probably a reference to Arabians who lived in the desert, people who cut their hair short in order to honor a pagan god. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the ones who cut the hair on the sides of their heads

contextId.information: Yahweh is telling them they will be there for a long time. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Build houses and live in them. Plant gardens and eat their fruit

contextId.information: Here this refers to the people of Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The people of Judah think that they will be safe because the Chaldeans had left. AT: "Surely the Chaldeans are leaving us, so we will be safe." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Surely the Chaldeans are leaving us

contextId.information: It is implied that they would give their provisions to Ishmael and his men. AT: "for we will give you our provisions that we have hidden in a field" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: for there are provisions of ours in a field

contextId.information: It is implied that they were afraid that the Chaldeans would attack them. AT: "because they thought the Chaldeans may attack them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

AT: "The people of Chemosh are destroyed by their enemies" or "The enemies of the people of Chemosh destroyed them". (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
